result.execSummary:
The defendant Noah G. Minster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have NO CONTACT with the COPPS Food Center located in Wautoma.
Upon successful completion of probation term, Defendant may petition the Court for expungement pursuant to s. 973.015.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:30 PM: Defendant Noah G. Minster in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wishes to waive his right to counsel to be able to discuss this matter with the ADA on resolution.  Off Record for Def to speak with ADA.  Back of Record @ 1:47 PM:  NGP entered.   Resolution reached and recited by ADA with argued terms on sentencing.   Def will wish to argue for a shorter term of probation.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Court accepts State's Motion to amend to allege Theft, contary to s. 943.20(1)(a) - Plea:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Statement by Def:  Requests a 9 mos period of supervision.  The Court:  Accepts resolution - 45 days WCJ - I/S - (GT, Huber, No TS Credit) S/W - 1 yr probation.  Conditions:  AODA and any follow thru as recommended, make agent of progress already made on counseling; the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; No contact with Copps Food Center located in Wautoma; Restitution of $19.99 - to be paid in full no later than 3/1/2016; Court Costs plus DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court - 60 DTP or PP.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Appeal Rights Given.  Upon successful completion of probation term, expungement opportunity granted by the Court.

Case Called @ 2:06 PM: Defendant Noah G. Minster in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty. ADA serves a copy of the Complaint - Receipt Admitted - Def reviews Complaint on his own - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel - no funds to retain his own counsel.  Def referred to SPD for eligibility process.  NGP entered by Court.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Court  Status conference scheduled for December 29, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
Restitution Summary and Statement of Loss/Damage - $19.99
